Trace

Add function desciption

_trace(self, nfeats, efeats, input_cache, fprog)
Parameters

  • nfeats – A dictionary containing node features norm and h

  • efeats – A dictionary containing edge features

  • input_cache – A dictionary

  • fprog – None = head(None)

Return type

source code for _trace()
 1def _trace(self, nfeats, efeats, input_cache, fprog):
 2    backend = self.find_backend(self._nspace)
 3    central_node = self._init_central_node(nfeats, efeats, fprog, backend)
 4    old_libs = defaultdict(dict)
 5
 6    self._monkey_patch_namespace(old_libs, input_cache, fprog, backend)
 7    ret = self._f(central_node)
 8    self._remove_patch(old_libs, backend)
 9
10    if ret == None:
11        raise NameError('Ret is none. Execution is aborted')
12
13    return [ret.var] if not isinstance(ret, Iterable) else ret.var

Function Overview

2backend = self.find_backend(self._nspace)
3central_node = self._init_central_node(nfeats, efeats, fprog, backend)
4old_libs = defaultdict(dict)

self.find_backend returns a tuple containing information about the backend being used. The tuple is of the form (backend-name, backend-module-instance).

>>> (pdb) p backend
('torch', <module 'torch' from '/home/nithin/anaconda3/envs/seastar-new/lib/python3.10/site-packages/torch/__init__.py'>)

central_node is a CentralNode object returned by _init_central_node().

>>> (pdb) p central_node
<seastar.node.CentralNode object at 0x7fa5cb667340>

old_libs is a defaultdict with the default_factory argument as a dictionary. To learn more about defaultdict, refer this

>>> (pdb) p old_libs
defaultdict(<class 'dict'>, {})
todo explanation for line 6 and 8
6self._monkey_patch_namespace(old_libs, input_cache, fprog, backend)
7ret = self._f(central_node)
8self._remove_patch(old_libs, backend)

self._f makes a call to the function nb_compute() with central_node passed as an argument. The returned value is stored in ret

>>> (pdb) p ret
V2(ValType.D,[1433],grad:None)

10if ret == None:
11    raise NameError('Ret is none. Execution is aborted')
12
13return [ret.var] if not isinstance(ret, Iterable) else ret.var

Incase ret has the value None, an error is raised and execution is aborted. The return statement just makes sure that the return value is an iterable.

>>> Return value from Context._trace: [V2(ValType.D,[1433],grad:None)]
